div.p: Authorized district officials may disclose information about a former employeeâ€™s job performance to a prospective employer.Â District officials are immune from civil liability for such disclosures under the following conditions:

ol.li: Â Disclosure of information is upon request of the prospective employer; or
Â Disclosure of information is upon request of the former employee;
Â The information is related to job performance;
Â The action is presumed to be in good faith.

Â The disciplinary records[1] of a district employee who has been convicted of a crime listed in ORS 342.143 are not exempt from disclosure under ORS 192.501 or ORS 192.502 and may be released to any person upon request. Prior to the disclosure of a disciplinary record an education provider shallÂ remove any personally identifiable information from the record that would disclose the identity of aÂ child, a crime victim or a school employee who is not the subject of the disciplinary record.

Â The disclosure is the result of a request from a law enforcement agency, the Department of Human Services or the Teachers Standards and Practices Commission regarding the records of investigations of suspected child abuse by a district employee.

div.p: Presumption of good faith is rebutted by showing the information disclosed was:

cite.span: [1] Disciplinary records is defined as records related to a personnel discipline action or materials or documents supporting that action.Â
